title: Shopify's stock tumbles after surprise loss, while revenue tops expectations
text: Shares of Shopify Inc. SHOP, -4.18% tumbled 4.6% in premarket trading Tuesday, after the provider of e-commerce services to retailers reported a surprise third-quarter loss, while revenue rose above expectations. The net loss widened to $78.9 million, or 64 cents a share, from a loss of $17.1 million, or 22 cents a share, in the year-ago period. Excluding non-recurring items, the adjusted per-share loss was 29 cents, compared with the FactSet consensus for earnings per share of 11 cents. Revenue rose 45% to $390.6 million, above the FactSet consensus of $383.8 million, as both subscription and merchant solutions revenue topped forecasts. During the quarter, Shopify said it surpassed 1 million merchants on its platform, and had announced the availability for merchants in most U.S. states to start selling hemp or hemp-derived cannabidiol (CBD) products. The company expects fourth-quarter revenue of $472 million to $482 million, above the FactSet consensus of $470.6 million. The stock has more than doubled (up 135%) year to date through Monday, while the S&P 500 SPX, -0.05% has advanced 21.2%.
